events.title: Michelangelo's David is unveiled
events.description: Michelangelo's statue of David was unveiled in Florence, symbolizing the Renaissance artistic achievement and the defense of civil liberties in Florence.
events.significance: It became one of the most famous sculptures in the world and a masterpiece of Renaissance art.

events.title: Galveston Hurricane hits Texas
events.description: One of the deadliest natural disasters in U.S. history, the Galveston hurricane struck near Galveston, Texas, causing massive destruction and loss of life.
events.significance: Killed an estimated 6,000 to 12,000 people, highlighting the need for improved weather forecasting and disaster preparedness.

events.title: Italy announces armistice with the Allies
events.description: Italy formally announced its surrender to the Allied forces during World War II, switching sides after the fall of Mussolini's regime.
events.significance: Marked a significant turning point in WWII, altering the balance of power in the Mediterranean region.

events.title: Luna 11 orbits the Moon
events.description: The Soviet spacecraft Luna 11 entered lunar orbit to gather data on the Moon's surface and environment.
events.significance: Advanced lunar exploration and contributed valuable data for future missions.
